mapper.insert: insert into member( member_uid, dept_code, job_code, company_code, member_id, password, member_name, address, tel, member_image, member_role, member_yn ) values ( UPPER(#{companyCode}) || '.' || #{memberId}, #{deptCode, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{jobCode, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, UPPER(#{companyCode, jdbcType=VARCHAR}), #{memberId, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{password, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{memberName, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{address, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{tel, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{memberImage, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{memberRole, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, 'Y' )
mapper.select: SELECT m.member_uid, m.dept_code, d.dept_name, m.job_code, j.job_name, m.company_code, c.company_name, m.member_id, m.member_name, m.address, m.tel, m.member_image, m.member_role FROM member m INNER JOIN department d ON m.dept_code = d.dept_code INNER JOIN job j ON m.job_code = j.job_code INNER JOIN company c ON m.company_code = c.company_code WHERE m.company_code = UPPER(#{companyCode}) AND m.member_yn = 'Y' ORDER BY m.job_code

SELECT company_code, business_type, order_type, company_name, business_code, owner_name, tel as company_tel, address as company_address, company_logo, reg_date as company_reg_date, reg_user as company_reg_user, update_user as company_update_user, update_date as company_update_date, use_yn FROM company
SELECT dept_code, dept_name, dept_yn, reg_date as dept_reg_date, reg_user as dept_reg_user, update_date as dept_update_date, update_user as dept_update_user FROM department
SELECT job_code, job_name, job_yn, reg_date as job_reg_date, reg_user as job_reg_user, update_date as job_update_date, update_user as job_update_user FROM job
